abstract.p: Bronx River Restoration Project is granted $16,500 grant for volunteer water-quality monitoring, habitat restoration and community outreach programs; Greenburgh Nature Center is granted $15,000 for habitat restoration and educational programs; Mohansic Elementary School in Yorktown Heights, NY, is granted $15,000 for outdoor classroom for environmental courses (S)

block.p: Twenty-four state grants totaling $372,212 have been awarded to community and environmental organizations in New York City and Westchester County to promote stewardship of natural areas, encourage community involvement in environmental protection and educate the public about the value of natural resources. Among the grants are $16,500 to the Bronx River Restoration Project in the Bronx for volunteer water-quality monitoring, habitat restoration and community outreach programs along the Bronx River; $15,000 to the Greenburgh Nature Center in for habitat restoration and educational programming; and $15,000 to the Mohansic Elementary School in Yorktown Heights for an outdoor classroom for environmental courses.
